title: Highest Percentage of Permanent Cropland
description: In 2022, 60% of Tuvalu's land area was dedicated to permanent cropland, marking it as the highest percentage globally.

title: Top Recipient of Net ODA as a Percentage of GNI
description: Tuvalu received net official development assistance (ODA) amounting to 79.85% of its Gross National Income (GNI) in 2022, the highest percentage worldwide.

title: Leading in Net ODA Received Relative to Imports
description: In 2022, Tuvalu's net ODA was 110.18% of its imports of goods, services, and primary income, the highest ratio globally.

title: Highest Net ODA Received Per Capita
description: Tuvalu received $6,361.09 per capita in net ODA in 2022, the highest amount per person globally.

title: Lowest Nitrous Oxide Emissions from Industrial Processes
description: In 2023, Tuvalu recorded a minimal nitrous oxide emission of 0.0001 Mt CO2e from industrial processes, showcasing its low industrial pollution levels.

title: Minimal Population Size
description: As of 2023, Tuvalu's total population was recorded at just 9,816, making it one of the least populated countries globally.

title: Low Mobile Cellular Subscriptions
description: In 2021, Tuvalu had only 9,000 mobile cellular subscriptions, indicating limited mobile network penetration.

title: Limited Secondary Education Enrollment
description: In 2023, only 1,252 students were enrolled in secondary education, reflecting challenges in educational access.

title: High Dependency on Imports
description: In 2022, Tuvalu's imports of goods and services totaled $57,387,705, highlighting its reliance on external sources for goods and services.

title: Minimal Threatened Bird Species
description: As of 2018, only one bird species in Tuvalu was classified as threatened, indicating a relatively stable avian biodiversity.

title: Low Urban Access to Safe Drinking Water
description: In 2022, only 10.47% of Tuvalu's urban population had access to safely managed drinking water services, highlighting a significant public health challenge.

title: Minimal Nitrous Oxide Emissions from Waste
description: Tuvalu recorded a negligible nitrous oxide emission of 0.0001 Mt CO2e from waste in 2023, reflecting its low waste-related pollution levels.

title: Low GDP in Current US$
description: In 2023, Tuvalu's GDP was $62,280,311, indicating a small economy with limited economic output.

title: Minimal Out-of-Pocket Health Expenditure
description: In 2022, out-of-pocket health expenditure accounted for only 0.37% of current health expenditure, suggesting a low financial burden on individuals for healthcare.
